item.title: Pytokei, calling rust's tokei from python
item.description: In this blog post I will walk through the steps I followed to start with rust, what resulted in pytokei, a python wrapper of tokei. ❯ pytokei pytokei pytokei ┏━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┓ ┃ language ┃ Files ┃ Lines ┃ Code ┃ Comments ┃ Blanks ┃ ┡━━━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━┩ │ Rust │ 9 │ 1011 │ 846 │ 49 │ 116 │ │ Python │ 5 │ 568 │ 436 │ 13 │ 119 │ │ Markdown │ 11 │ 423 │ 123 │ 179 │ 121 │ │ Plain Text │ 4 │ 133 │ 0 │ 133 │ 0 │ │ TOML │ 3 │ 75 │ 59 │ 6 │ 10 │ │ YAML │ 1 │ 69 │ 63 │ 0 │ 6 │ │ Makefile │ 1 │ 26 │ 18 │ 0 │ 8 │ │ Dockerfile │ 1 │ 16 │ 7 │ 3 │ 6 │ │ Shell │ 3 │ 12 │ 12 │ 0 │ 0 │ │ Autoconf │ 3 │ 7 │ 7 │ 0 │ 0 │ └────────────┴───────┴───────┴──────┴──────────┴────────┘ Intro After reading Rust’s book, I was looking for a excuse to build something in Rust.
